header.overview: The header defines a macro used to convert a to a representation suitable for use as an argument list.

macro.abstract: The macro converts its argument to a representation suitable for use as an argument list.
macro.para: If tuple is nil, this macro expands to (). Otherwise, it expands to tuple.
This macro operates on the nil representation used by the core operations defined in . Specifically, () is a one-element , not a zero-element .
macro.listing:
#include #include #include #include
#if
#define APPLY(prefix, tuple) \ (prefix, (tuple)) \ (tuple) \ /**/
#define MACRO_0() #define MACRO_1(a) a #define MACRO_2(a, b) a * b #define MACRO_3(a, b, c) a * b * c
#define MACRO(args) (APPLY(MACRO_, args))
MACRO() // MACRO((1)) // 1 MACRO((1, 2)) // 1 * 2
#endif
